1: This is what the Lord says: “Because Moab has committed three crimes[a]— make that four[b]—I will not revoke my decree of judgment.[c] They burned the bones of Edom's king into lime.[d]
2: So I will set Moab on fire,[e] and it will consume Kerioth's[f] fortresses. Moab will perish[g] in the heat of battle[h] amid war cries and the blaring[i] of the ram's horn.[j]
3: I will remove[k] Moab's leader;[l] I will kill all Moab's[m] officials[n] with him.” The Lord has spoken!
4: This is what the Lord says: “Because Judah has committed three covenant transgressions[o]— make that four[p]—I will not revoke my decree of judgment.[q] They rejected the Lord's law;[r] they did not obey his commands. Their false gods,[s] to which their fathers were loyal,[t] led them astray.
5: So I will set Judah on fire, and it will consume Jerusalem's fortresses.”
6: This is what the Lord says: “Because Israel has committed three covenant transgressions[u]— make that four[v]—I will not revoke my decree of judgment.[w] They sold the innocent[x] for silver, the needy for a pair of sandals.[y]
7: They trample[z] on the dirt-covered heads of the poor;[aa] they push the destitute away.[ab] A man and his father go to the same girl;[ac] in this way they show disrespect for[ad] my moral purity.[ae]
8: They stretch out on clothing seized as collateral; they do so right[af] beside every altar! They drink wine bought with the fines they have levied; they do so right in the temple[ag] of their God![ah]
9: For Israel's sake I destroyed the Amorites.[ai] They were as tall as cedars[aj] and as strong as oaks, but I destroyed the fruit on their branches[ak] and their roots in the ground.[al]
10: I brought you up from the land of Egypt; I led you through the wilderness for forty years so you could take the Amorites' land as your own.
11: I made some of your sons prophets and some of your young men Nazirites.[am] Is this not true, you Israelites?” The Lord is speaking.
12: “But you made the Nazirites drink wine;[an] you commanded the prophets, 'Do not prophesy!'
13: Look! I will press you down, like a cart loaded down with grain presses down.[ao]
14: Fast runners will find no place to hide;[ap] strong men will have no strength left;[aq] warriors will not be able to save their lives.
15: Archers[ar] will not hold their ground;[as] fast runners will not save their lives, nor will those who ride horses.[at]
16: Bravehearted[au] warriors will run away naked in that day.” The Lord is speaking.
